Docs.summary: The Resource Manager API includes operations for triggering and managing restore actions of the items protected by your Recovery Services Vault.

abstract member TriggerRestoreAsync : string * string * Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.Models.CustomRequestHeaders * string * string * string * string * Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.Models.TriggerRestoreRequest * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.Models.BaseRecoveryServicesJobResponse>
MemberSignature.Usage: iRestoreOperations.TriggerRestoreAsync (resourceGroupName, resourceName, customRequestHeaders, fabricName, containerName, protectedItemName, recoveryPointId, request, cancellationToken)

Docs.param: Resource group name of your recovery services vault.
Name of your recovery services vault.
Fabric name of the protected item.
Name of the container where the protected item belongs to.
Name of the protected item whose recovery points are to be fetched.
ID of the recovery point whose details are to be fetched.
Restore request for the backup item.
Docs.summary: The Trigger Restore Operation starts an operation in the service which triggers the restore of the specified item in the specified container in your Recovery Services Vault based on the specified recovery point ID. This is an asynchronous operation. To determine whether the backend service has finished processing the request, call Get Protected Item Operation Result API.
Docs.returns: Base recovery job response for all the asynchronous operations.
